fields.description:

BTW:
* Also the text "The API methods are documented can be found at http://your-bamboo-host/api/index.action." needs an "AND". 
* Can the URL text (the href seems correct) actually refer to the correct URL rather than http://your-bamboo-host/api/index.action.
fields.summary: Incorrect link to documentation
Artifact copier does not handle '301 Moved Permanently'

fields.description:
The Bamboo build-in metrics and reporting are only minimalistically useful.  I'd like to see a  customizable dashboard where I can easiliy see different build plans/projects vertically down the page with selected built-in and user-defined build and test metrics horizontally across the page.  This would be use for dev managers to quickly assess overall product quality across several components.    Types of metrics to display would include:

Code coverage %  (with links to the detailed html artifact reports generated by Clover, NCover, Cobertura, Bullseye. 
Unit Tests (#, pass, fail )  (with links to the detailed html artifact reports generated by Clover, NCover, Cobertura, Bullseye. 
Static Code analyis ( severe, critical, warning, info for Coverity, PMD, Fortify, FindBugs, etc) with links to the  detailed artifact reports
SLOC
Fisheye (# files changed, # lines changed,  by author )


The dashboard should also be able to allow display of trend graphs for each of the metrics:

[ Drop down box:   Unit Tests ]               [ Time frame:    Last 90 days ] 

Project A        < graph  of unit tests over time > 
Project B       < graph  of unit tests over time >
Project C       < graph  of unit tests over time >

----------------------------

[ Drop down box:   Code coverage  ]               [ Time frame:    Last 90 days ] 

Project A        < graph  of code coverage over time > 
Project B       < graph  of code coverage over time > 
Project C       < graph  of code coverage over time > 


As an example, have a look at how Borland's TeamInspector (TM) displays build and test dashboard info: 

http://www.borland.com/us/products/team/team-inspector/index.html
http://www.borland.com/images/products/team/team-inspector/team-inspector-screen-lg.jpg
fields.summary: Add  support for custom user-defined build and test metrics and show them on a configurable dashboard page

fields.description: I'd like to see GUI improvement where I can easily edit the Artifacts items in the Bamboo Configuration page in-place instead of having to delete and re-create them when I want to make a simple change.
fields.summary: Make it easier to edit Artifacts items in the Configuration page

fields.description:
We've installed the Bamboo plugin for Jira as per the installation instructions.

The plugin works, but the links point back to the wrong server - the server address is the Jira server NOT the bamboo server.

As a consequence, all links form Jira to Bamboo are broken, including images. Additionally, the Bamboo portlets for Jira do not work and instead give back the error:

HTTP/1.1 404 There is no Action mapped for namespace bambooajax and action name jsBuildSummaryAll Check if there is such an action name with such namespace defined in the xworkxml and also if such an action class exists Check also the log to see if the action class is successfully loaded
fields.summary: Bamboo links created in Jira by the Bamboo plugin are incorrect
Notifications tab when creating plan ui is very screwed
Mac OSX installer doesn't ask for or set Bamboo Home property

fields.description:
Bamboo runs p4 clients to verify the plan's client against all available clients. In case there are a lot of clients this leads to performance issues when executing a plan.

Bamboo can verify the existence of the client with {{p4 -c <client-name> info}} and will receive an error before continuing the configuration or build process.

This way the expensive operation p4 clients can be spared.
fields.summary: Verification of Perforce client may cause performance problems

fields.description:
Hello.

Our plans have developers are all in the user group "developer".  For each of our plans, in the permissions, we have the group "developer" assigned "view" and "build" rights.

They all can see the choice to enable or disable a plan in the dropdown, as per the doc:
http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/BAMBOO/Granting+Plan+Permissions+to+Users+or+Groups

However, if they click on it, they get a "Access Denied
Sorry, you have insufficient permissions to view the page. Please contact an administrator if you believe this is an error. 

Go to...
Site Homepage " page.

In the log it prints out something along the lines of:
2009-07-23 17:26:50,467 WARN [btpool0-2] [AuthorizationLoggerListener] Authorization failed: org.acegisecurity.AccessDeniedException: Access is denied; authenticated principal: org.acegisecurity.adapters.PrincipalAcegiUserToken@d39be46a: Username: com.atlassian.bamboo.user.DefaultBambooUser@9786e65a; Password: [PROTECTED]; Authenticated:true; Details: null; Granted Authorities: ROLE_USER; secure object: ReflectiveMethodInvocation: public abstract void com.atlassian.bamboo.build.BuildManager.saveBuild(com.atlassian.bamboo.build.Build); target is of class [com.atlassian.bamboo.build.HibernateBuildManager]; configuration attributes: [ACL_BUILD_EDIT]

fields.description:
Currently IE7 doesn't support 'min-width' (it just uses 'width') to make our buttons look nice, it would be good to have two static button sizes e.g 80px, and 120px and if buttons are too big for the small one they should use the big one.  

The only problem with this is that someone needs to go through all of Bamboo to find where there are buttons that are too big.

http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/BAM-4233
fields.summary: Check Form Button Width

fields.description:
I also have some wording suggestions for your screen phpunit-builderconfiguration.png:
* "Where shall PHPUnit store test result file" --> "Where should PHPUnit store the test result file?"
* "Log test execution in XML format to file" --> "Log test execution to XML file"
* "Where shall PHPUnit store code coverage data in Clover format" --> "Where should PHPUnit store Clover code coverage data?"
* "Write code coverage data in Clover XML format" --> "Generate code coverage data in Clover format"
* "Where shall PHPUnit store code coverage data in HTML format" --> "Where should PHPUnit store HTML code coverage data?"

fields.description:
modifying a remote agent capability in bamboo-capabilities.properties does not modify the capability in bamboo.
if the same capability key is used but the value changed in bamboo-capabilities.properties bamboo does not update to the new value if the key had been used before.

Only deleting the cap in bamboo and restarting the remote agent helps to update the cap to the new value.
fields.summary: Updating bamboo-capabilities.properties on the agent should synchronise capabilities with server

fields.description:
Hi bamboons,

I'm struggling to answer this customer's question from the docs and was hoping that someone could help me out. Here's the discussion, so far:

1. This customer believes that we have incorrect file references in our wrapper.conf file, as mentioned here:
http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/BAMBOO/Bamboo+Standalone+Installation+Guide+%28Linux%29?focusedCommentId=196117052#comment-196117052

2. I had a chat with Brydie when she was covering support for Uli and answered the customer with this response (basically that the conf directory is a sibling of the lib directory):
http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/BAMBOO/Bamboo+Standalone+Installation+Guide+%28Linux%29?focusedCommentId=196117397#comment-196117397

3. However, he cannot find a lib directory that is a sibling of the conf directory, as per this comment:
http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/BAMBOO/Bamboo+Standalone+Installation+Guide+%28Linux%29?focusedCommentId=196117575#comment-196117575
fields.summary: Incorrect references in wrapper.conf in Bamboo tar.gz package for Linux

fields.description:
A possibility to invalidate Hibernate cache used in ORM on Bamboo's database would be handy to reload/re-read data directly from database after e.g. making bulk changes in plans. In case when a myriad of similar plans is maintained rather via database (updating XML_DEFINITION_DATA) than by clicking on all the possible plans in UI. Now it has to be done by restarting Bamboo, since Hibernate cache (with a rather long TTL) keeps the old definitions and the new ones from the database are visible after restart. Restarting the build server's app is very inconvenient especially when using Elastic Bamboo, since shutting down instances and starting them up again (with success!) takes a significant amount of time.

The functionality itself could be implemented either as a button e.g. "Reload DB" in Administration interface e.g. on Database Configuration tab. A more sophisticated version could show it only in case of real databases - MySQLs or PostgreSQLs, but not in case of embedded HSQL databases - as it doesn't make sense I suppose. Having it in UI would allow the verification of who can reload it (not allowing of mischievous behaviour if Bamboo server is accessible from public network).

A simplified (or just a quick-win solution) would be to allow making an HTTP request to Bamboo's UI or API to execute Hibernate cache invalidation.
fields.summary: Enable invalidating Hibernate cache to read changes from database

fields.description:
Maybe similar to a build trigger reason.

You could specify exactly why a build failed, and this could have a spot in the UI to get displaued.  Therefore plugins have a single place to go to provide feedback to the user on why that plugin failed the build.  E.g the clover plugin would have a failure reason "code coverage dropped to much" and have a corresponding message for the UI.

This could also be used to better highlight the fact that a build failed due to someone cancelling it.
fields.summary: Pluginable Build Failure Reason
Allow plugins to customise the Build Results Summary page

fields.description: It would be nice if when defining capabilities  they could be defined globally and be detected by agents automatically. For example define the capability with type "JDK",  Label of  "Java_1.6", and Java Home of  "/opt/jdk/jdk1.6.0_14". When a new agent is registered it should look to see if Java_1.6 Java Home of /opt/jdk/jdk1.6.0_14 exists in the file system. If it does the capability should automatically be registered for the agent. Of course you could always override the path for that specific agent as well as manually disable the capability.
fields.summary: Capabilities should be able to be defined globally for detection by the agent

fields.description:
Currently the xml file substitutes in the ${bambooHome} information, it would be cool if it could substitute in other stuff, e.g a system property which could be set progratically.

The use case for this is if a user want to have a script to start up agents or multiple agents and programatically wants to define the different aspects of where all the bits should go.  More specifically, pointing agents to a common build-dir to reduce checkout time and size.
fields.summary: Be able to programatically set the properties in the agents bamboo.cfg.xml

fields.description:
the getBuildDefinition(Build build) method in the DefaultBuildDefinitionManager, dies badly when trying to call it during the plan creation wizard.    

The problem is that during creation the full plan key (e.g BAM-MAIN) is null, causing a null pointer when you try to retrieve it from the cache.

The nice behaviour should be that the method just returns null.
fields.summary: getBuildDefinition() fails badly if called during plan creation

fields.description:
When selenium test (run by rake (ruby) ) fails it hangs the build process.
I successfully stopped the build by logging into the server and stopping the selenium server.

Now I not sure if this is a bug or a feature, but it seems like bamboo agent detects that there are child processes running and wait (indefinetly) for the child processes to stop.
Now .. the bad thing, when it fail the rake script aborts, but bamboo thinks the build is still running. So our post command "rake stop" is never run.
That may or may not be a bug ;)

But in this state it is impossible to stop the build.
Also when bamboo notices that the build is hung and you choose to cancel it, it can´t. It even seems from the log that the remote agent died and came back up and the damn build was still running.
fields.summary: Selenium builds with ruby hangs when they fail (remote agent/windows)

fields.description: It would be good to see the stack traces of the builds that have failed in the "View test case across builds" screen. Often you want to know if a test is failing in the same way across multiple builds. The only way to do this currently is to look at each build in turn. It would be nice if the stack traces for the build failures were shown on this screen for the last couple of builds.

fields.description:
At times a residual write.lock file may be left in <bamboo-home> subdirectories such as index and database...

These files should be removed during server startup to avoid indexing problems, plan expiry etc.

Not sure if this is a potential harm if bamboo is already running and a second instance is started accidentally.

https://support.atlassian.com/browse/BSP-1932
fields.summary: Write.lock files should be removed from bamboo-home during server startup

fields.description:
USE CASE:
Have a child build plan and a parent build plan.
Both plans force a clean checkout.

Change both plans' repository URLs after you have run already a few builds from the 1st URL.
Trigger the parent plan.

EXPECTED:
When triggered by the parent, the child plan's agent detects the changed repository, checks out from the new URL on the parent's SVN revision.

ACTUAL:
The child plan's agent detects the changed repository, checks out from the new URL on the HEAD revision.

Here is an example: The repo urls of parent and child have changed _before_ SVN-LANGANT-13 was triggered. While  SVN-LANGANT-13 was running a few commits have been made to the repository which _should not_ be picked up by the child plan
